content.description:
This route climbs a series of short, double cracks 15' right of

Tombstone Shadow

. With fifteen feet of actual climbing it makes it hard to recommend this route - this is however the easiest way to the top of the formation.
content.protection: Gear to 2", rap off anchors atop Tombstone Shadow or Shoot At Will

climbs.name: Tombstone Shadow
climbs.fa: Bob Cable, Julia Cronk '89,  First lead: Dave Bridges, Mike Rigney, 1991

content.description:
A fun route which takes the line up the center of the face using an undercling then thin edges and lieback flakes, the crux is moving right and onto the rest ledge one bolt from the top.

The opening moves up to the high first bolt are worrying, there's a good small Friend placement in a slot though before the undercling flake. The crux section also feels a tad runout.
This is a wide crack which narrows the higher you get and is rife with positive holds.
content.protection:
Gear to 2.5", use anchors on

Firepower

.

climbs.name: Shoot at Will
climbs.fa: Jim Hammerle, Rick Shull & Dave Masuo, 1989,  FL: Chris Miller, 1990

content.description:
Starts in a recessed area and wanders up the featured face above rife with positive edges and flakes to a chain anchor at the lip.

Fun moves with great exposure the higher you get make this a popular route for the grade.
content.location: Located on an East-facing wall around and outside of the Tombstone Pit proper.

content.description: Bouldery moves down low (like it's neighbor to the left) soon give way to arete pulling on this short, even somewhat squeezed feeling route. Despite the way it sounds, the moves are enjoyable enough to give it a spin if in the area.
content.location:
This route is located just right of

Firepower

in the Tombstone Pit.

content.description:
Bouldery moves at the start (being tall helps) gain larger holds at the second bolt and fun edges lead to the top.

Bolted on lead, which resulted in a grounder placing the second bolt when a hook popped - ouch!
content.location:
This short, south-facing climb is located on the face directly across from

Tombstone Shadow

.

content.description: Climbs the obvious and somewhat dirty chimney system. Not especially memorable.

climbs.name: Dead Man Chalking
climbs.fa: (TR) Bob Cable, Julia Cronk, FL: Chris Miller & Cheryl Basye, May 2000

content.description: Bouldery moves at the start gain the arete where fun and sometimes balancy moves lead up and right to anchors shared with Tombstone Shadow.
content.protection: 5 bolts, chain anchor (shared with Tombstone Shadow)
content.location:
This route is found on the arete just left of

Tombstone Shadow

and across from

Firepower

;

Shoot at Will

is located around the corner to the left.
